algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using sets to count unique elements and common elements.
problem_summary_simple: Maximize the size of a set formed by remaining elements after removing half from two arrays.
problem_summary_technical: Use sets to find unique and common elements, then greedily select elements to maximize the final set size.
key_insights: The goal is to maximize the number of unique elements in the final set.
Identify common elements between nums1 and nums2, as these are valuable for maximizing the set size.
Greedily prioritize keeping unique elements from each array up to n/2 removals, then use common elements if space permits.
